reviews.review_msg:
I had Dr. Shinkar for both CMPT 125 and 405, and I have to say, he is definitely the best professor I've ever had in my life. He is able to simplify complex topics and make them super easy to understand. Whether it be in the middle of lecture or on Piazza, he encourages you to ask questions, and he is always willing to help. 

He is the best!

Great professor who always responds to students' inquiries quickly. A minor drawback is that the course seems to be a little bit disorganized. Some of the logistics and policies are not clarified beforehand.

As we all know, algorithm class is a difficult course, but what he tought is easy to understand. 
Even some of my interviews, all questions can be found from his lecture.
If he is teaching the course you want. Go for it.

Hardest class I've taken. Super nice guy and tries to make your life easier when he can. Try to understand general concepts rather than stressing over specific details and proofs. You'll need to come up with solutions to hard problems you haven't seen before on exams, so don't take if you're not good at algorithms. Watch/attend all lectures
If you like taking on challenges, take this course. The material is HARD, way too HARD.

Algorithm is one of the most difficult courses in SFU CS. However, Valentine gives clear lectures and is a solid choice for this class. There are 4 difficult assignments that each take about 520 hours to finish that reinforce the in-class learning. Exams are fair and consist of questions similar to the assignment.

Nice guy, but avoid his class, I don't understand how he expects you to finish his 50 minute midterm in time, hard to believe he is a full professor and still doesn't understand this, how many more years until you figure this out Joe, maybe you don't really care although it seems like you do. Proof, some can do, some can teach ...

The prof was 100% dedicated to making the learning experience best possible for the students. Even then, the material is difficult and hard to focus at, so either read carefully in advance or prepare to study on your own after the lecture.

I took this honour's course on a whim and had a pleasant surprise - it was actually rather interesting. Petra was quite enveloped in the material and guided us along at a wicked pace. Sadly, the fun ended at the exams, as she really makes them difficult.

The professor is really nice and freakishly smart. I asked him about a few coding interview problems i got stuck on and he can just instantly find the solution

For this course, the midterms are only questions from the textbook. The people who got 100% all went through each problem with chatgpt/google and ignored the slides. The final though...
prof is okay but horrible TA.
Extremely fair midterms and finals, if you do the textbook questions and assignments they are a breeze

A great professor. The people complaining about his accent are wild, he has an accent but he speaks clearly and is easy to understand. Assignments and exams were difficult but fair. If you do the assignments and make sure you understand them you will do well. His lectures are good and he will answer all questions thoughtfully.
So hard

Ignore what others say about his accent. He's PERFECTLY understandable, these people just want an excuse for their lack of effort. This is one of the better profs of the faculty, he's very fair and responds quickly to questions. The assignments are fantastic for preparing for the midterm. Grading distribution is great too. Very respectable prof.

The course is extremely heavy and he didn't try to make it better. Writing this review 16 hours before the final exam and half of the assignments are not graded yet. 12 chapters are included in the final exam that's worth 40% of the total grade. His explanation is OK at best. Excruciatingly hard assignments that are worth only 5% each.

He looks cold and dull, but is indeed approachable and warm-hearted inside. Always reply to emails quickly and try his best to help you for any questions or requests. Language barrier may sometimes be a problem, but it is totally understandable as he actually speaks three languages(Japanese also). Don't be hard on this.

wonderful prof. explains things clearly, everything posted online so attendance is optional. exams are fair and its easy to do well if you put in some studying. The accent is not a problem. AT all. I dont know how people complaining about that survive in this city. Highly recommend.

I am a fourth year cmpt student. Still cannnot understand what he is talking about during the class. He explains the algorithm with very theoretical way, not even one specific number. If you are not good at this, avoid this professor. Very boring lecture, I think only 10 out of 50 people interested in what he is talking about.

Very good professor, explained material well, even though it was at times difficult. I learned a lot in the course under him. He simplifies some proofs in the textbook so attending lectures is essential. He is somewhat soft-spoken, so I suggest sitting near the front. Exams were somewhat difficult and consisted of 2-5 questions, but they were fair.
People aren't fair to him, he's not that bad... just very disorganized.
Leonid is passionate about his field and research. He is also extremely knowledgeable. However, teaching doesn't seem to be his main focus.

Leonid is a great yet tough professor. Expect to commit a lot of time in his course. 10% of your grade is participation, so showing up, going to office hours and asking questions gets you easy marks. He is very knowledgeable and easy to talk to. I've never seen anyone recite a lecture from memory before, but he makes it look easy. Would recommend!
final was hard, but this guy is the funniest in comp sci. he's into arts (pottery) as his first name suggests as well. very smart and sympathetic.
entertaining and fair
Funny, and a good teacher
He rocks!
